New Records: Chris Sale won his major league-leading 15th game
Chris Sale had six strikeouts to match San Diego's Dylan Cease for the major league lead with 197 this year
Chris Sale set a single-season Braves franchise record for a left-hander
Key Match Events: Jorge Soler homered early and threw out a runner at the plate late
Matt Olson hit an RBI double and Luke Williams added a two-run double in a four-run seventh
The Twins had runners at second and third with no outs and the bases loaded with one out, but they failed to score in the fourth when Sale delivered two strikeouts and an inning-ending groundout

Post-Match Reflections: Sale lowered his ERA to 2.58, currently the best in MLB
The Twins had runners at second and third with no outs and the bases loaded with one out, but they failed to score in the fourth when Sale delivered two strikeouts and an inning-ending groundout
Twins rookie David Festa (2-4) had his finest start to date spoiled by Sale and Soler
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins got only one run across in the sixth despite four hits and three straight to start the frame
Manny Margot was waved in by third base coach Tommy Watkins on a single by Ryan Jeffers and easily thrown out by Soler from right field for the first out
